item.title: End-of-life choices and dying trajectories

item.description: As part of my postdoctoral fellowship, I lead a research project called Perspectives and Theoretical Analyses of Suffering in the Euthanasia and Physician-Assisted Dying context (PATHOS).

item.title: Covid-19 projects
item.author: dominique.girard@radboudumc.nl (Dominique Girard, Psy.D/Ph.D)
item.description: My projects regarding the lived-experience of healthcare professionals and caregivers during the Covid-19 pandemic take root in inspiring collaborations with Valérie Bourgeois-Guérin, Ph.D., and Mélanie Vachon, Ph.D., two researchers from Université du Québec à Montréal.

item.title: A glossary of medical end-of-life practices
item.author: dominique.girard@radboudumc.nl (Dominique Girard, Psy.D/Ph.D)
item.description: Many terms may arise in end-of-life care discussions, such as ‘euthanasia,’ ‘assisted suicide,’ ‘withholding treatment,’ ‘withdrawing treatment,’ and ‘palliative sedation.’ They are often misunderstood and sometimes confused. Understanding these terms can assist in decision-making and ensuring quality of life.

item.title: Art-inspired projects
item.author: dominique.girard@radboudumc.nl (Dominique Girard, Psy.D/Ph.D)
item.description: As a humanistic psychologist, I believe that we can come to a greater understanding of ourselves through arts (e.g., poems, paintings, dance, photography).
